reports.report_title: Audit of Corporate Records Management & Retention (IA_Report_Records_Retention_Compliance.pptx)
reports.executive_summary: Objectives: To assess compliance with statutory records retention periods and secure destruction protocols. Background: The company handles sensitive customer data and legal contracts across various jurisdictions. Scope: Review of physical archiving facilities and digital document deletion schedules.

details.observation: Financial records dating back 15 years are still stored on-site, despite a 7-year legal retention limit.
details.risk: Increased litigation discovery risks and excessive storage costs.
details.recommendation: Execute a bulk shredding project for all documents past their retention period.

details.observation: Highly sensitive payroll documents were found in regular recycling bins instead of locked shredding consoles.
details.risk: Unauthorized disclosure of PII and potential GDPR/regulatory fines.
details.recommendation: Replace open recycling bins in administrative areas with locked security consoles for sensitive paper.

recommendations: Update the Global Records Retention Schedule.
Conduct annual training on sensitive data handling.
Partner with a certified secure destruction vendor for site-wide clearances.

reports.report_title: Audit of Operational Petty Cash Management (IA_Report_Petty_Cash_Controls.pptx)
reports.executive_summary: Objectives: To verify the security of petty cash funds and the validity of small-value disbursements. Background: 15 regional branches maintain petty cash floats ranging from $500 to $2,000. Scope: Surprise cash counts and voucher audits at 5 selected regional branches.

details.observation: 3 out of 5 branches visited did not perform weekly cash reconciliations as required by policy.
details.risk: Undetected theft or loss of funds; financial reporting inaccuracies.
details.recommendation: Mandate a weekly sign-off by the Branch Manager on a standardized cash reconciliation form.

details.observation: Personal funds and ‘IOU’ notes from employees were found in the petty cash lockbox at one location.
details.risk: High risk of fraud and lack of accountability for corporate assets.
details.recommendation: Strictly prohibit ‘IOUs’ and enforce immediate disciplinary action for commingling of funds.

recommendations: Perform monthly unannounced cash counts by Regional Controllers.
Phase out physical petty cash in favor of corporate ‘P-Cards’ for small spend.

reports.report_title: Audit of Knowledge Management & SOP Governance (IA_Report_Internal_Communications_Knowledge.pptx)
reports.executive_summary: Objectives: To ensure Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) are current, approved, and accessible. Background: The company maintains a central repository for over 500 operational policies. Scope: Review of the policy lifecycle management and version control on the company Intranet.

details.observation: 40% of the SOPs on the Intranet have not been reviewed or updated in the last 3 years.
details.risk: Employees following obsolete processes leading to operational errors or safety risks.
details.recommendation: Implement an automated ‘Expiry’ flag that requires owners to re-verify SOPs annually.

details.observation: Draft versions of sensitive financial policies were accessible to all employees via a shared folder.
details.risk: Unauthorized use of draft procedures and potential for internal fraud.
details.recommendation: Move all policy documents to a dedicated Document Management System (DMS) with restricted permissions.

recommendations: Enforce a mandatory annual review cycle for all operational policies.
Consolidate all SOPs into a single, permission-controlled system.
Retire the use of ungoverned shared network drives for policy storage.

reports.report_title: Audit of Employee Onboarding & Offboarding Controls (IA_Report_Onboarding_Offboarding.pptx)
reports.executive_summary: Objectives: To ensure new hires are properly vetted and terminated employees lose access promptly. Background: The company hired 300 and offboarded 120 employees in the last 12 months. Scope: Verification of background checks for new hires and system deactivations for leavers.

details.observation: 10% of new hire files lacked evidence of completed criminal or education verification checks.
details.risk: Hiring of unqualified or high-risk individuals; regulatory non-compliance.
details.recommendation: Make background check clearance a prerequisite for generating an employee ID.

details.observation: 5 terminated employees retained active VPN and Email access for more than 72 hours after their final day.
details.risk: Potential for data exfiltration or unauthorized system changes post-employment.
details.recommendation: Implement an automated ‘Leaver’ workflow that disables all accounts at midnight on the termination date.

recommendations: Standardize the onboarding checklist to include all vetting requirements.
Automate the offboarding notification between HR and IT.
Conduct quarterly access reviews for ‘stale’ accounts.

reports.report_title: Audit of General Ledger & Financial Closing Process (IA_Report_Financial_Closing_Operations.pptx)
reports.executive_summary: Objectives: To assess the speed, accuracy, and control environment of the monthly financial close. Background: The Finance team aims for a ‘5-Day Close’ to provide timely management information. Scope: Audit of journal entry approvals and balance sheet reconciliations for Q4 2025.

details.observation: 12% of manual journal entries were posted to the General Ledger without a secondary reviewer’s approval.
details.risk: Fraudulent financial reporting or material errors in the financial statements.
details.recommendation: Enable a ‘hard stop’ in the ERP that prevents posting without a workflow approval.

details.observation: Bank reconciliations contained ‘open items’ older than 90 days that had not been investigated.
details.risk: Hidden financial losses or failure to identify bank errors.
details.recommendation: Implement a policy requiring all reconciling items older than 30 days to be escalated to the Controller.

recommendations: Enforce automated workflow approvals for all manual journals.
Standardize balance sheet reconciliation templates across all subsidiaries.
Conduct monthly ‘Closing Quality’ reviews with regional teams.
